result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica A Bird was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica A Bird

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jessica A Bird in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:21 PM. Also called 14CM90, 14CM98, 14CM253, 15CM22 and 15CF24. 14CM08 - amend #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle, #2 - DRI, $500 forfeiture plus costs totalling $834.50. State agrees. Court dismisses and reads in count #2 and amends count #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle, pleads NC, finds G, forfeiture of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50; 14CM90 - plead to OWI 2nd, OAR 1st and to count #3 as alleged, DRI count #4, dismiss #5 - OWI - 2 years probation with conditions of free to argue for jail (up to 45 days), $1615.00 fine inclusive of costs, 14 month DL suspension, AODA, IID for 1 year, $35.00 cost reimbursement for blood draw to FOSO, absolute sobriety, no possession and no entry, employment/school, 100 hours of community service, attend at least one AA meeting each week and report all meetings attended to P&P agent; OAR - assessments, BJ - 2 years probation, concurrent, withheld sentence, costs and surcharges. Bird and State agree. Bird pleads NC to count #1, #2 and #3, court dismisses counts #4 and #5; 14CM98 - amend count #1 to county ordinance of BJ, forfeiture of $1000 plus costs, DRI #2. State and Bird agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #2 and amends count #1 to county ordinance of BJ, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $1000.00 plus costs totalling $1464.50; 14CM253 - plead to count #1 as alleged and #2 and #3 will be DRI, count #1 - 2 years probation concurrent to 14CM90, withhold sentence with same conditions with 100 hours of community service - concurrent to 14CM90. Bird and State agree.. Bird pleads NC to count #1 as alleged, Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3. 15CM02 - amend #1 to DC with $500 fine plus costs and surcharges totalling $1083.00, DRI counts #2, #3 and #4. State and Bird agree. Court amends count #1 to DC contrary to, reads new penalties, dismiss and read in counts #2 and #3, Bird pleads NC to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, acceps plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 45 days in FC jail on 14CM90. Lucareli makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 7 days in FC jail with 15 days credit if revoked. Bird makes statement, asks for time to report. Court reviews files. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 14CM90 - #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain/maintain full time employment/school, $35.00 to FOSO for blood draw costs, 100 hours of commuinity service, attend one AA meeting each week and provide verification of attendance to P&P agent, fine of $1615,00 - inclusive of costs - 60 DTP/CO, 45 days in FC jail - huber, good time and community service allowed under 973.03(3) - report by 8:30 AM on 7/15/15 - reserve ruling on credit at this point - parties can file stipulation and JOC can be amended then and woould be applied only if revoked, 14 month DL revocation, IID on DL and all vehicles titled in her name for 14 months commencing upon issuance of valid DL; #2 - costs only of $443.00 - 60 DTP/CO, #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to count #1, with same conditons except no additional jail or community service; 14CM253 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to 14CM90, with same conditions except additional costs of $443.00 and no additional community service of jail, 15CM02 - fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $1083.00 - 60 DTP/CO, right to appeal. State has filed a petition on all matters to forfeit bond. No objection has been filed. State will move to withdraw petition to forfeit bond and suggests it be used to pay the fines that she was just assessed. Court will accept the withdrawal of the petition to forfeit bond, use bond posted to pay all fines, remainder of bond can be refunded to poster(s). Lucareli thanks State for resolving the matters.
Jury trial scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.

Defendant Jessica A Bird in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also called 14CM98, 145CM90, 14CM253,  and 14CM08. Lucarelli has complaints, waives reading of all of them, stands mute on pleas. Court enters NG pleas to all counts on all cases. Lucaerli - asks for $5000.00 cash total on all cases for stated reasons (retainer fee). State - no objections but does want some cash. Court will keep bond on all cases at this point for stated reasons but will re-visit the issue regarding releasing money to the attorney. After reviewing the files further, court will adjust the bond down as follows: $1500.00 cash on each and release balance posted to Lucareli's trust account, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns will be a condition on each bond. Court sets all matters for FPT's.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 04-29-2015 02:15 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Jessica A Bird
Current: P.O. Box 500, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 04-21-2015)
Prior: 5042 Billy Daniels Ln, Crandon, WI 54520

Called at 9:23 AM, Also called 14CM08, 14CM90 and 14CM98. Jessica Bird does not appear nor does any attorney on her behalf. Court fofeits all bonds posted, $4000 warrant on new case and $2000 on each of the other cases.
No consumption and no enter taverns
